casebody.data:
BRIGHTON CONSTRUCTION, INC., PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. L & J ENTERPRISES, INC., DEFENDANT AND THIRD-PARTY PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. BENJ. GRUNAUER COMPANY, A NEW JERSEY CORPORATION, THIRD-PARTY DEFENDANT-RESPONDENT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued November 19, 1973 Decided January 4, 1974.

Before Judges Lynch, Mehler and Michels.

Mr. Richard K. Rosenberg argued the cause for plaintiff-respondent (Heller & Laiks, attorneys; Mr. Richard K. Rosenberg, of counsel, and Mr. Herbert R. Ezor, on the brief). Mr. Robert B. Hermes argued the cause for appellant (Hermes & Gitlin, attorneys; Mr. Robert B. Hermes of counsel and on the brief). Mr. Milton C. Yarrow argued the cause for third-party defendant-respondent.

Before Judges Lynch, Mehler and Michels.

Per Curiam.

The judgment of the Chancery Division is affirmed essentially for the reasons set forth in the opinion of Judge Kole.
